棄.definition: to abandon; to relinquish; to discard; to throw away

棄世.definition: to leave this world; to die

棄之如敝屣.definition: to toss away like a pair of worn-out shoes (idiom)

棄劇.definition: to quit watching a TV series

棄取.definition: (literary) to choose between rejecting and accepting

棄嬰.definition: to abandon an infant; abandoned baby

棄子.definition: sacrificed piece (in chess or Go); abandoned child; (fig.) sth that has been abandoned or sacrificed (an ally, a product, employees etc); (in expressions such as 拋家棄子|抛家弃子[pao1jia1-qi4zi3]) to abandon one's child(ren)

棄守.definition: to give up defending; to yield; to surrender

棄惡從善.definition: to renounce evil and turn to virtue (idiom)

棄暗投明.definition: to renounce the dark and seek the light; to give up one's wrong way of life and turn to a better one

棄權.definition: to waive a right; to abstain (from voting); (sports) to forfeit (a game); to voluntarily withdraw from a match

棄用.definition: to stop using; to abandon; abandoned; deprecated

棄約背盟.definition: to abrogate an agreement; to break one's oath (idiom)

棄舊圖新.definition: to turn over a new leaf

棄若敝屣.definition: to throw away like worn out shoes

棄農經商.definition: to abandon farming and become a businessman (idiom)

棄邪歸正.definition: to give up evil and return to virtue

棄養.definition: to abandon (a child, elderly family member, pet etc); (literary) (of one's parents) to pass away
